column1: author          content
@soupydev       a website for startup ideas
@adarsh         tinder for openclaw
@ycombinator    devops + tooling for fleets of agents. prompts, reliability, monitoring, costs. spark-like infra for agent swarms.
@ycombinator    consumer software versions of accountants, tutors, trainers, lawyers. bring “rich-people services” to everyone.
@ycombinator    fast, AI-driven vocational schools for electricians, welders, HVAC. massive data-center buildout, not enough skilled labor. gov money + urgency.
@ycombinator    human-level phone agents. replace call centers, IVRs, hold music. trillion-call market.
@ycombinator    ML physics sim - replace physics solvers with learned models. orders-of-magnitude faster predictions.
@ycombinator    B2B stablecoin infra, custody, payments. regulation easing, volumes exploding.
@ycombinator    use reasoning models to design ASICs/FPGAs. target extremely specialized hardware.
@ycombinator    AI-powered CAD, EDA, CFD. design planes, chips, buildings faster with reasoning models.
@ycombinator    scale cheap MRI screening with AI. catch cancer early, save lives.
@ycombinator    for regtech, design LLMs to read regs, policies, data. continuous audits, no sampling. massive headcount replacement.
@ycombinator    (b2b) AI tax accountants, billers, QA testers. real workflows, real integrations, insane growth once it works.
@matteopaz06    hyperspecialized models and rl environments for cybersecurity/whitehat. contract w/ gov, build up a cyberweaponry division around you.
@resorcinolworks a saas which generates a roadmap for learning skills according to the latest trends
@sama           sell insurance for 80% less than what it currently costs + handle escrow. racket and a big market. seems like a straightforward >$1B company.
@sama           when startups raise a round, they want fixed income on the cash. existing services suck and are $$$.

@matteopaz06    humans will be the bottleneck for medicine discovery. engineer a fully automated wetlab in a box, sold as units. ai could validate, explore, and self-improve independently without slowdown.

@willccbb       two-sided matching market for semi-durable semi-skilled labor (bars/restaurants, retail, events, security, construction). launch w/ regional chains in select cities/verticals b/o local research, grow network.
